Sirens in Kissufim, east of Gaza. There is a threat of rocket launches from Gaza.
Sirens in Kissufim, east of Gaza. There is a threat of rocket launches from Gaza.
Sirens continue to sound. No reports of explosions yet.

The Head of the Donetsk Military-Civilian Administration announced mandatory evacuation orders for all families with children from the city of Dobropillya and nearby settlements, as shown on the map above.    These settlements include:  Dobropillya (city)‚Ä¶

Yesterday, mandatory evacuation orders were announced for all families with children in the city of Kramatorsk, Donetsk Oblast. The Donetsk OVA head stated that around 53,000 civilians remain in the city.
Sirens continue to sound. No reports of explosions yet.
One rocket was launched from the Khan Younis area of southern Gaza. The IDF stated that it impacted an open area. No casualties are reported.
Iskander on Nizhyn, Chernihiv Oblast.
Iskander on Nizhyn, Chernihiv Oblast.
Flying further to Desna-Chornobyl.
Flying further to Desna-Chornobyl.
Disappeared east of Desna, Chernihiv Oblast.
Iskander-K cruise missile to Desna, Chernihiv Oblast.
Iskander-K cruise missile to Desna, Chernihiv Oblast.
Flying to Vyshhorod, north of Kyiv. Southwestern course.
Flying to Vyshhorod, north of Kyiv. Southwestern course.
Bypassing Kyiv from the north, flying west towards Borodyanka.
Bypassing Kyiv from the north, flying west towards Borodyanka.
Approaching Borodyanka from the northeast
Approaching Borodyanka from the northeast
Flew past the city to Zhytomyr Oblast. Course unchanged.
Flew past the city to Zhytomyr Oblast. Course unchanged.
Disappeared northeast of Zhytomyr City.

In the Pokrovsk direction, Russian forces continue to advance and have made significant progress in the southern suburbs of the city.
Russian forces advanced east from their foothold in the Kalynivka District, completing its capture and reaching the Shakhtarskyi District. Other forces then pushed north, occupying the largely empty positions and trench fortifications to the south, and completed the capture of the fortified areas at the railway intersection.
Additionally, they continued to advance north up the railway line, capturing the rest of Chunyshyne and most of Novopavlivka. Despite this, the guitar-shaped fortification to the south is still yet to be cleared. 
Russian assault units and DRGs are now actively operating in the Shakhtarskyi District, although there is no known established line of contact here, and the situation remains very fluid. DRGs are probably entering from the west in the area of Yuvileynyy Park, and from the south from the Kalnyivka District. 
+ ~12.0km¬≤ in favour of Russia.

Russian forces have captured the village of Zelenyi Hai, Novopavlivka direction, Donetsk Oblast.
Pre-war population: ~915.
Total land area: ~2.08km¬≤.

In the Novopavlivka direction, Russian forces continue to advance and have made additional progress in the area of the Donetsk-Dnipropetrovsk Regional Border.
Russian forces advanced in four areas. In the east, they cleared out most of the remaining Ukrainian positions in the salient northwest of Oleksiivka, advancing downhill from the tactical heights. They were able to cross the border into Dnipropetrovsk Oblast, capturing most of a treeline heading west.
To the southwest, Russian forces expanded their zone of control in Donetsk Oblast, capturing positions along three different treelines and reaching the regional border.
To the west, Russian forces advanced further northwest from Dachne in Dnipropetrovsk Oblast, establishing control over a forest and nearby forest plantations in the low-lying ground. They were also able to re-secure the western part of Yalta and secured the treelines northeast of Zirka. 
In the west, Russian forces advanced from their foothold in the southeastern houses of Zelenyi Hai, expanding outwards and clearing the rest of the residential part of the village. They then pushed further west, capturing the farm buildings and positions in the adjacent treelines. 
+ ~30.39km¬≤ in favour of Russia.
The Ukrainian GUR released footage of one of their agents setting fire to a Russian Su-27UB combat-capable trainer aircraft at Armavir Airbase, Krasnodar Krai.

Yesterday, mandatory evacuation orders were announced for all families with children in the city of Kramatorsk, Donetsk Oblast. The Donetsk OVA head stated that around 53,000 civilians remain in the city.

I've added a new layer to the interactive map showing the evacuation zone imposed by Ukrainian authorities on frontline settlements. 
https://www.google.com/maps/d/u/0/edit?hl=en&mid=1thW9kqnDOaS2lAepLhLdzSX8Ur9Sc4k&ll=49.81803016284687%2C33.63210332439323&z=7

Footage showing the current state of the Shakhtarskyi and Lazurnyi Districts in southern Pokrovsk. 
Despite extensive Russian bombardment by FAB glide-bombs, artillery, MLRS, and drones, the vast majority of the high-rise buildings remain standing and usable for defence (but obviously mostly unliveable for civilians). Because Ukraine doesn't have the manpower to hold the city right now it won't really matter that much for them, but once Russia occupies these buildings, they can still use them as positions. 
Currently, most of these buildings are in the grey-zone, with both sides actively operating there with no solid line of contact.

Footage showing the current state of the Shakhtarskyi and Lazurnyi Districts in southern Pokrovsk. 
Despite extensive Russian bombardment by FAB glide-bombs, artillery, MLRS, and drones, the vast majority of the high-rise buildings remain standing and usable for defence (but obviously mostly unliveable for civilians). Because Ukraine doesn't have the manpower to hold the city right now it won't really matter that much for them, but once Russia occupies these buildings, they can still use them as positions. 
Currently, most of these buildings are in the grey-zone, with both sides actively operating there with no solid line of contact.

Israel Mourns Three Soldiers As Hamas Shares More Combat Footage From Gaza
Two Israeli soldiers were killed and an officer was moderately wounded by an explosive device in the southern Gaza Strip on July 26, the military announced.
Both slain soldiers were serving as technicians in the reconnaissance unit of the Israeli Defense Forces (IDF) elite Golani Brigade.
Also on the same day, the IDF acknowledged that a reservist combat engineer who was seriously wounded by a roadside bomb in southern Gaza a week before succumbed to his wounds. The soldier was serving in the ranks of the 749th Combat Engineering Battalion.
Read more:

Russia Is Testing Unmanned Assault Tank 
Russia‚Äôs giant tank maker Uralvagonzavod is currently testing a new optionally-unmanned assault tank dubbed ‚ÄúShturm.‚Äù
Video footage showing the tank and its command vehicle returning to Uralvagonzavod‚Äôs complex in Nizhny Tagil after a round of tests surfaced online on July 27. Both the tank and its command vehicle are reported to be built on the chassis of T-72/T-90 main battle tanks.
One of the main features of the Shturm is the shortened barrel of its 125 gun. This is meant to improve the maneuverability of the tank in urban areas. Launchers for thermobaric weapons, possibly a version of the man-portable RPO-A Shmel, are also installed on the tank‚Äôs turret.
üëâ

Russia‚Äôs Ka-52M Attack Helicopter Appears In ‚ÄòDrone-Buster‚Äô Configuration
A photo showing a Russian Ka-52M attack helicopter in what appears to be its drone interceptor configuration appeared online on July 27.
These helicopter began to play a key role in intercepting Ukrainian fixed-wing suicide drones over the special military operation zone and behind it in recent months.
Helicopters can fly at low altitudes and speeds which make them very suitable for intercepting slow and small aerial targets like drones.
The Ka-52M in particular is very suitable for this role as it is equipped with Arbalet-52 dual-band coherent pulse radar and the GOES-451M electro-optical targeting system which are reportedly capable of detecting aerial targets from a range up to 15 kilometers.
üëâ

Clashes Continue On Thai-Cambodian Border Despite Trump‚Äôs Call For Ceasefire 
Thailand and Cambodia exchanged fire across their disputed border for a fourth day on July 27, hours after United States President Donald Trump announced the leaders of the two countries had agreed to ceasefire talks.
Thailand hit several locations in Cambodia with drones, tank fire, cluster and aerial bombs early on July 27 morning local time, a spokesperson for Cambodia‚Äôs defense ministry told reporters.
Meanwhile, the state-run National Broadcasting Services of Thailand reported that Cambodian forces had fired artillery into Surin, damaging residential homes. Thai forces were responding, it added.
üëâ

Israeli Defense Minister Threatens To Target Iran‚Äôs Khamenei
Defense Minister Israel Katz on July 27 threatened Iranian Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, hinting that Israel could attack Iran again.
Israel attacked Iran on June 13, stating that its goal was to cripple Iran‚Äôs nuclear program. Later, it expanded its targets to include the Islamic Republic‚Äôs missile program. A ceasefire was suddenly announced on June 24, just two days after the United States joined the war by attacking three key nuclear sites.
‚ÄúI want to convey a clear message to Khamenei the dictator,‚Äù said Katz during a visit to the Ramon Airbase in southern Israel, according to his office. ‚ÄúIf you continue to threaten Israel, our long arm will again reach Tehran and with even greater force ‚Äî and this time to you personally. Do not threaten, lest you be harmed.‚Äù

Russian Army Is Testing Kalashnikov-Armed FPV Drones 
The Russian military is testing first-person-view (FPV) multirotor drones armed with Kalashnikov-type rifles, according to video footage released by TASS on July 24.
The footage shows one such drone engaging a vehicle from a close range, most likely during a test. The Russian news agency noted, however, that the Kalashnikov-armed drone was being developed to intercept and shoot down Ukrainian grenade-dropping multirotor drones, commonly known as ‚ÄúBaba Yaga‚Äù.
